rename.from: Extract sort-imports member sorting into a separate rule
rename.to: Add sort-imports member sorting into a separate option

body:
The proposal to add an option to turn off declaration sort seems reasonable to me. :+1:

@remcohaszing are you will to submit a pull request for this proposal?
I'll give it a try somewhere this week.

issue.title: Update: Add sort-imports ignoreDeclarationSort (fixes #11019)

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This change enhances an existing feature of ESLint

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
This allows users to enforce sorting import members, without having to enforce
sorting of import declarations.

fixes #11019

body:
Can someone look into the related PR ? There hasn't been any action taken in over a month, and I'm also very interested in having a rule to check ordered and sorted imports.
Thank you for your PR @remcohaszing :)
Thanks for the ping, we'll take a look.

**TSC Summary:** This proposal seeks to add another option, `ignoreDeclarationSort` to `sort-imports` to allow turning off a part of the rule that previously was required. The option is backwards-compatible and there is already a pull request (https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/11040) for implementation. This issue fell off of the radar and so is missing feedback, but I will champion.

**TSC Questions:**

* Should this proposal be accepted?
* Should https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/11040 be merged?

Rule changes do not require TSC consent, unless they are breaking. In that case, it looks like there's a champion and 1 up vote already on the proposal. It's now up to the champion to gather more support from the rest of the team, until this issue can be accepted.
Is any action required from me? I thought not, but its taking much longer to get merged than I expected.

@remcohaszing thanks for the ping. Sorry, a lot of team members are taking time off around this time of year, so things can take a bit longer than usual. It looks like enough team members support this change so I'm marking as accepted. The next step is to review the PR.
